Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a man's bearded head with thick lips, squat nose, protruding eyes and ears. Hollow, mould-made, with white coating, pink paint on skin and red on lips. Brown Nile silt fabric with grey core and fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Higgins sites a close mid 5th century BC Rhodian parallel for this piece (1954, 406, no. C642, no.1548; Rhodian parallel no.269).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (1548)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DC.306) (Phase 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Egypt Exploration Fund (Committee of)
